newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Kim to suspend union arrest warrants.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Kim to suspend union arrest warrants.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young-sam said on Tuesday he would suspend the execution of arrest warrants for strike leaders, the domestic Yonhap news agency said.
Yonhap did give details but seven leaders of the militant Korean Confederation of Trade Unions are sheltering from arrest at Seoul's Myongdong Cathedral.

Kim was speaking at a lunch meeting with opposition leaders Kim Dae-jung of the National Congress for New Politics and Kim Jong-pil of the United Liberal Democratic Party. Lee Hong-koo, chairman of the ruling New Korea Party, also attended.
The meeting aimed to resolve a crisis over a controversial new labour law, which was rammed through parliament on December 26, triggering more than three weeks of wildcat strikes.

In a sign authorities want a peaceful end to violent confrontation with labour unions over the law, prosecutors have said they would hold off arresting confederation leader Kwon Young-kil and six deputies holed up at the cathedral.
